title: Hi there, I’m Joe.
text:
I am a clinical scientist in genetics, working in the UK’s National Health Service.
I specialise in developing new genetic tests for rare diseases and cancer, and I love coding in R!
This website is a place to collate the stuff I work on and am interested in.
joseph.shaw3@nhs.net

title: Fun Projects
text: This was a cool project to plot the season statistics for the Richmond Dukes baseball team in London, who are managed by my friend Alvin. You can see the finished graphs here and also check out the code in the Github repo if you’re interested.

title: Lab Tests
text: My job is to make new tests for genetic laboratories. These are the lab tests I have developed so far in my career, starting with the most recent.

title: Lab Tests
text:
Description
Overview
Outcome: publication
Timing: September 2019-January 2022
Location: North London Genomic Laboratory Hub
Technique: droplet digital PCR
Code: Github repo
Skills I learned

How to write code in R.
How to write an original research paper.
How to collate data and manipulate it in RStudio.
How to use version control with Git.
How to optimise ddPCR assays.
